title: 106_hr5333
content: The Act is titled the "Federal Employees' Overtime Pay Limitation Amendments Act of 2000." It amends Title 5 of the United States Code regarding overtime pay for employees with basic pay exceeding the minimum rate for GS-10. The overtime hourly rate is one and a half times the minimum hourly rate for GS-10. The Federal Employees' Overtime Pay Limitation Amendments Act of 2000 amends Title 5 of the United States Code to address overtime pay for employees with basic pay exceeding the minimum rate for GS-10. It includes provisions for special rates of pay and premium pay for emergency work involving a direct threat to life or property. The Federal Employees' Overtime Pay Limitation Amendments Act of 2000 addresses overtime pay for employees with basic pay exceeding the minimum rate for GS-10. It includes provisions for special rates of pay and premium pay for emergency work involving a direct threat to life or property, with overtime pay calculated at one and one-half times the hourly rate of basic pay, subject to certain limitations. The Federal Employees' Overtime Pay Limitation Amendments Act of 2000 allows for premium pay for emergency work, with the determination made by the agency head in consultation with the Director of the Office of Management and Budget. The Act also sets limitations on the aggregate of basic pay and premium pay for employees. The Federal Employees' Overtime Pay Limitation Amendments Act of 2000 allows premium pay for emergency work, with limitations based on the maximum rate of basic pay for GS-15 or the rate for level V of the Executive Schedule. Employees paid premium pay for emergency work are subject to regulations set by the Office of Personnel Management. The Federal Employees' Overtime Pay Limitation Amendments Act of 2000 allows premium pay for emergency work, with limitations based on the maximum rate of basic pay for GS-15 or the rate for level V of the Executive Schedule. Employees may receive premium pay under specific provisions of the law if their total pay exceeds certain thresholds in a calendar year. The Federal Employees' Overtime Pay Limitation Amendments Act of 2000 allows premium pay for emergency work, with limitations based on pay rates. The Office of Personnel Management can regulate premium pay for certain employees, while exemptions apply to FAA and DoD employees under specific sections. Amendments take effect after 120 days from enactment.
